text:
I'm not complaining about the library just to be clear - I use it all the time and really like it. Just one of those "wut" moments.

Usually I just map(x -> fn, eachcol(a)), didn't know about mapcols :slightly_smiling_face:.

text: Thank you for the feedback. I commented, because this is one of these things that we keep not-working in DataFrames.jl because they are an error in Julia Base. Similarly broadcasting of `DataFrameRow` is disallowed because it is not allowed for `NamedTuple` and this is also a thing that people complain.

text: I understand the situation you're in with that. That said, I think you all have done an awesome job overall on DataFrames. I was looking at the code earlier for a possible weird extension too it.

elements.text: I understand the situation you're in with that. That said, I think you all have done an awesome job overall on DataFrames. I was looking at the code earlier for a possible weird extension too it.

text: I can't share the example, but, I was able to load a large CSV into a dataframe in 2.6s. The other technology that was available took >30s.
